posts.post_content:
I just wanna know one thing: How good is this in Commander? See, I bought Kaalia's deck. I'm kind of going for a Kongregate theme (White Soldiers, Red Orcs, Black Zombies, White Angels, Red Dragons, Black Demons, Inferno Titan, Sun Titan, Grave Titan) so I can go Epic War all over the battlefield. Warsturm Surge, Wrath of God, etc.
  
   
Any way, I really, really, really want to use Lightning Bolt. In every other format, if your deck generates Red Mana, Lightning Bolt is auto-include. But...I'm a little skeptical about it in Commander. If I have the Premium Deck Series one, is it a valid argument to just include it for the sake of awesome, regardless of whether it is good enough or not?
  
   
It's probably a question best answered by answering: "Is {R} for 'remove 3 loyalty counters from target Planeswalker' worth it?" Planeswalkers might justify some special attention.
  
   
Last question: How many of you think the best place for your Premium Deck Series Bolts playset is probably in your ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
NOOOOOOOOOO ITS LEAVING US!!!!!!!!! seriously wizards wtf?! at least reprint incinerate again, i dont want to go back to the old shock days...  
  
EDIT: WHEW! good at least they confirmed incinerate, AND [goblin grenade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=goblin grenade)!!! i still have mixed feelings about this trade off (not every red player runs goblins) but if they kept both red would have been nucking futs. and [incinerate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=incinerate) IS still quite good.   
  
bottom line we can still avoid [shock](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=shock) like the plague thanks to [galvanic blast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=galvanic blast), [burst lightning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=burst lightning) etc.

Posted By: Kyzar (6/24/2011 8:01:54 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Player 1: And I end my turn.  
Player 2: Oh yeah? Well first off I'll--  
Player 1: In response, [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt).  
Player 2: What? You don't even know what I was going to--  
Player 1: Doesn't matter, the answer's always [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt).  
  
Combos with [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt), [Reverberate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reverberate), [Unstable Footing](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unstable Footing), [Mountain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mountain), [Quest for Pure Flame](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Quest for Pure Flame), [Pyromancer Ascension](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pyromancer Ascension), [Chandra's Spitfire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chandra's Spitfire), [Kiln Fiend](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kiln Fiend), [Fire Servant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fire Servant), [Surreal Memoir](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Surreal Memoir)... that's just Standard Monored combos and there's still too many to name.  
  
[Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt) is to red what [Counterspell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Counterspell) is to blue.
posts.html:
Player 1: And I end my turn.
Player 2: Oh yeah? Well first off I'll--
Player 1: In response, Lightning Bolt.
Player 2: What? You don't even know what I was going to--
Player 1: Doesn't matter, the answer's always Lightning Bolt.

Combos with Lightning Bolt, Reverberate, Unstable Footing, Mountain, Quest for Pure Flame, Pyromancer Ascension, Chandra's Spitfire, Kiln Fiend, Fire Servant, Surreal Memoir... that's just Standard Monored combos and there's still too many to name.

Lightning Bolt is to red what Counterspell is to blue.

posts.post_content:
On constructed: Play it if you're playing red.
  
On limited: Play it if you're playing red. Sometimes, play it even it you aren't.
  
   
I just read something from an article on the 10th ed [Incinerate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Incinerate), when it was, and I quote, "a burn spell so powerful that many had assumed we'd never bring it back." I suppose it would seem overpowered when you've been playing with [Volcanic Hammer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Volcanic Hammer) for years (I hate that card), but even so, this statement is incredibly outdated.
posts.html:
On constructed: Play it if you're playing red.
On limited: Play it if you're playing red. Sometimes, play it even it you aren't.

I just read something from an article on the 10th ed Incinerate, when it was, and I quote, "a burn spell so powerful that many had assumed we'd never bring it back." I suppose it would seem overpowered when you've been playing with Volcanic Hammer for years (I hate that card), but even so, this statement is incredibly outdated.

Posted By: Atali (11/4/2010 10:15:46 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Okay, what I'm about to say may not be popular to many of you guys out there but I just wanted to say that I dislike this card.  
It's because I have started playing magic when [Shock](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shock) was the staple burn card. And when I say staple I mean it. It's a classic card that everyone knows and were actually happy to have in their decks. Everyone was satisfied with it.  
-  
I do understand that with the powercreeping, it became necessary to print this again, to adjust the level of removal and creatures.  
Now that creautres are becoming "normal" again (not too cost efficient), I think it's a good thing that they gave us shock back.  
-  
I can understand people who have started playing with [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt) being disappointed, but what I'm trying to say is. It's been a GIFT to the players that they've reprinted this card. Shock and its 2 damage variants are fine. Lightning Bolt should NOT be the measuring stick to which we must compare 1 mana burn spells. Shock is.
posts.html:
Okay, what I'm about to say may not be popular to many of you guys out there but I just wanted to say that I dislike this card.
It's because I have started playing magic when Shock was the staple burn card. And when I say staple I mean it. It's a classic card that everyone knows and were actually happy to have in their decks. Everyone was satisfied with it.
-
I do understand that with the powercreeping, it became necessary to print this again, to adjust the level of removal and creatures.
Now that creautres are becoming "normal" again (not too cost efficient), I think it's a good thing that they gave us shock back.
-
I can understand people who have started playing with Lightning Bolt being disappointed, but what I'm trying to say is. It's been a GIFT to the players that they've reprinted this card. Shock and its 2 damage variants are fine. Lightning Bolt should NOT be the measuring stick to which we must compare 1 mana burn spells. Shock is.
